Sentencas: Since a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is a complicated nonlinear, time-varying and constrained system, it is difficult to control the fuel flow to stabilize the output voltage while considering fuel utilization operating constraints.
Titulo: Optimal adaptive control for solid oxide fuel cell with operating constraints via large-scale deep reinforcement learning

Sentencas: To overcome this problem, an adaptive fractional-order proportional integral derivative (FOPID) controller, taking advantage of the adaptability and model-free features of large-scale deep reinforcement learning, is proposed in this paper.
Titulo: Optimal adaptive control for solid oxide fuel cell with operating constraints via large-scale deep reinforcement learning

Sentencas: Furthermore, a fittest survival strategy large-scale twin delayed deep deterministic policy gradient (FSSL-TD3) algorithm is designed as the tuner of this controller.
Titulo: Optimal adaptive control for solid oxide fuel cell with operating constraints via large-scale deep reinforcement learning

Sentencas: In this algorithm, the exploration efficacy is improved by way of the fittest survival strategy and imitation learning.
Titulo: Optimal adaptive control for solid oxide fuel cell with operating constraints via large-scale deep reinforcement learning

Sentencas: Other techniques are also applied to this algorithm in order to improve the robustness of FOPID controller.
Titulo: Optimal adaptive control for solid oxide fuel cell with operating constraints via large-scale deep reinforcement learning

Sentencas: In addition, by formulating the reward function of the FSSL-TD3 algorithm, the fuel utilization of the SOFC can always be kept in a safe range, which is not possible for conventional control algorithms.
Titulo: Optimal adaptive control for solid oxide fuel cell with operating constraints via large-scale deep reinforcement learning

Sentencas: The simulation results in this paper show that the output voltage of SOFCs can be controlled effectively by this controller while fuel utilization is retained within a reasonable range.
Titulo: Optimal adaptive control for solid oxide fuel cell with operating constraints via large-scale deep reinforcement learning
